publisher.publisher-name: College of Business Administration of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln

title-group.article-title: Minimum Wage Legislation: Goals and Realities

p.mixed-citation: Peyton Elder, "The 1977 Amendments to the Federal Minimum Wage Law," Monthly Labor Review 101 (January, 1978), pp. 9-11.
Vera Perrella, "Young Workers and Their Earnings, October, 1969," Special Labor Force Report No. 132 (Washington, D.C.: U.S. Government Printing Office, 1971), p. 4.

James F. Ragan, Jr., "The Theoretical Ambiguity of a Minimum Wage," Atlantic Economic Journal 5 (March, 1977), pp. 56-60,
Jacob Mincer, "Unemployment Effects of Minimum W ages," Journal of Political Economy 84 (August, 1976), pp. S100-S104;

Finis Welch, "Minimum Wage Legislation in the United States," in Orley Ashenfelter and James Blum, eds., Evalu- ating the Labor-Market Effects of Social Programs, Industrial Relations Section (Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1976), pp. 1-38.
James F. Ragan, Jr., "Minimum Wags and the Youth Labor Market," Review of Economics and Statistics 59 (May, 1977), p. 133.
Douglas Adie, "Teen-Age Unemployment and Real Federal Minimum Wages," Journal of Political Economy 81 (April, 1973), pp. 436-440;
Marvin Kosters and Finis Welch, "The Effects of Minimum Wages on the Distribution of Changes in Aggregate Employment," American Economic Review 62 (June, 1972), pp. 323-330.
"Labor's High Price," Wall Street Journal, April 12, 1977.
"Would the 'Teenwage' Cut Unemployment?" Business Week, September 19, 1977, p. 106;
Robert S. Goldfarb and Anthony Yezer, "Estimates of Teenage Elasticities of Substitution," paper presented at the 1976
